snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry warned Senator Dianne Feinstein that the release of the long-delayed review could ignite unrest in the Middle East and endanger hostages.
abstract: Obama administration warns Senate Intelligence Committee that releasing report on torture of prisoners once held by the Central Intelligence Agency could put American hostages at risk and incite violence in Middle East; warning is delivered to Sen Dianne Feinstein, who leads committee, by Sec of State John Kerry.

byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and CARL HULSE

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry warned Senator Dianne Feinstein that the release of the long-delayed review could ignite unrest in the Middle East and endanger hostages.

headline.main: Senate Panel Faces New Obstacle to Release of Torture Report
headline.print_headline: Senate Panel Faces New Obstacle to Release of Torture Report
